message:
Is it possible to physically place any monitor vertically? Even if it doesn't have that option built-in?
All I could find on Google is people trying to fix their accidentally-flipped monitor from Windows.

data.message:
to get monitors' ports
$ xrandr -q
to change monitor rendering
$ xrandr --output PORT --rotate REND

change PORT from results of 1st cmd, then REND = {normal|left|right|inverted}
I want to do that with one of my LED with Chromecast in order to cast my phones with portrait view.

I really didn't get the question are you asking if "all the manufactured monitors" could be placed vertically? is that the question? because that doesn't make sense to me at all, I mean every monitor has it's own design and case if it's designed to have multiple setup then let it be, if designers designed it to be horizontal then we can't do anything about it unless you  support it in a hacky way to remain vertically, and it sure depends on what kind of monitor you have.

vesa mount ;) i removed my stands and connected my 2 monitors to a double arm stand via the vesa mounts.. since the arms can move in any direction it can be set horizontally, veritcally or any angle left,right, up,down, forward or backwards. 
my left monitor has a screw leese and it likes to do the michael jackson thing by leaning forward

i have the first one
